website_summaries.verdict: Works best on well-maintained lawns for occasional aerating, but the shoes may not be able to handle harder jobs.
pros: Evenly patterns lawn when used with side-to-side stepping motion
Straps fit sturdy shoes fairly well
cons: Straps tend to loosen during use, and ends must be safely tucked out of the way of spikes
Clay soils and yards with little grass may cause mud cakes in spikes
Lighter users (below 165 pounds) may have to work harder to embed spikes

website_summaries.verdict: The best budget option for manually aerating your lawn with less work.
pros: Spiked sandal shoes fit over many different types of shoes and feet sizes
Easy to put on and off quickly
Heavy-duty spikes dig a few inches into the ground
cons: The aerator may not be suitable for larger yards since it can take time to cover large surface areas

customer_reviews.title: No really worth it. Look elsewhere for a full metal assembly.
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 1.5 uses. Not sturdy at all. I weigh 200lbs and two of the spikes bent at the plastic assembly. This needs to be made of metal or have a metal plate for strength.
customer_reviews.author: James Johns

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting to buy some aerator shoes for a while. I had some dirt work done in my side yard and the ground was packed down from the bull dozer and track hoe. I walked over almost an acre of lawn and did have to stomp a couple of times and adjust the straps some. I then went back the next day and sowed grass seed while wearing the aerators. I watered the part of the lawn I could reach with my water hose and I have a pretty good still stand of grass growing again. Good job!
customer_reviews.author: Becky Ursery White

customer_reviews.title: Pretty easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These are fairly simple to put together, even if you didn't have instructions. It just takes some time to put all the bolts and nuts in and tighten them down. Using them is also fairly simple, if a little awkward. Since they are a hard plastic, they don't bend and wearing them is a bit like walking in swim fins. But it certainly is a lot cheaper than paying a service to come out! And if you do it when you are mowing, you get two jobs done at once. Just make sure the ground is not super dry and solid when using these. They won't work well at that point.
customer_reviews.author: korriaan

customer_reviews.title: Need to be athletic
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 67-yr-old woman whose backyard grass was suffering. They go together very quickly, and can be tightened onto your foot for a snug fit. However, I was absolutely worn out when I finished using them. Had to step pretty hard in places to penetrate even wet ground. Wanted puncture holes a little bigger in places, so I twisted my foot a bit as I pulled prongs out of the ground. Worked well. Wished I were more athletic with strong leg muscles to use these.
customer_reviews.author: clickshopper

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Tried with shoes on and the straps were too short. Yes, I installed the appropriate lengths in the appropriate places (assembly tip). Then I tried with a “thinner” shoe which still did not work. I’m a US men’s 10.5 btw. So I figured I’d try with just my socks and finally I could get the straps over my feet but not without a great deal of pain with the straps cutting in every step and constantly slipping. Overall a very poor design. I threw them in the trash and went back to my hand aerator which I was hoping to avoid. Unless you have small feet and shoes, you’re better going the traditional route.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Aerator Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great Aerator Shoes! First thing to take note of are the straps are different lengths. I didn't realize that until I installed them. The shortest goes on the toe end. It is too short for the upper strap over your foot. I recommend you install the nails going down the center, it just makes it easier tightening all the nails. Finally I recommend you water the yard the night before for best aeration. These are cheaper in cost, easier to use and quicker than buying an aerator fork. If you walk like you are in a marching band they work better. I highly recommend these, great quality and great price.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie R. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: These work great and are fun to use, actually. This is my first time using a product like this, so I can't tell you just yet if my grass is any greener or healthier. But, I can say it was easy to assemble the shoes and easy to put on. Definitely don't wear them on concrete as the instructions state (I wasn't paying attention and stepped on concrete -- nearly twisted my ankle!) So, do all of your prepping, i.e. moving toys, hoses, etc. from the yard ahead of time. Once you do that you're golden. I wore them while cutting the grass.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kittle

customer_reviews.title: Worth a shot to try
customer_reviews.text: Not am awful product. Kinda a pain to put together concerning th straps. These are 1 size fits all, so if you have tiny feet, well they may slip off. Not sure if it is really making a huge difference in the yard, but the spikes are very sharp and does sink into the ground while walking. If you have a small yard and need this done to your yard, these are worth a shot to try
customer_reviews.author: jennifer martin

customer_reviews.title: Almost broke my ankle!
customer_reviews.text: Stay away from this product. Used it for no more than 10 minutes before it broke.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: No problem slipping off like other posts
customer_reviews.text: They work as advertised. Don't know how well the aerating will do as normally you would take a chunk out. These leave a bunch of 2" bolt sized holes in the ground. No problem slipping off like other posts. however, I did have one try to slip off if you walk a normal stride. If you stomp sideways like you're supposed to, they stay tight. Had one spike arrive without a point; had to take it to the bench grinder. Ive had one spike bend the plastic a little. Other than that, great product. Giving it a 4 due to the minor issues.
customer_reviews.author: RonJ

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time, avoid
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. For such a simple product, this required a painful amount of time to assemble. Once assembled, very difficult to put on over a size 10 1/2 (US) shoe. Despite many attempts, and various types of shoes, I could not get these to remain on my shoes for more than a few minutes. I have thrown mine away. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Roundle

customer_reviews.title: doesn't stay on your feet.
customer_reviews.text: I imagine if you are walking on a lush lawn for about 5 feet in these, they would work great. HOWEVER, on my average lawn that needs to be aerated these do not actually make holes or deep enough holes to make a difference, also they don't stay on your shoes. Super disappointed, total waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: jean steffins

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: Assembled them right away, a little tedious attaching all the spikes. Easy to put on, no slipping, great straps. Walked all over my lawn with ease. I let my 10 year old try them it was great. Amazing results without the annoying plugs from the conventional machines. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Medina

customer_reviews.title: Good all around.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for the yard and garden. Also step on weeds and turn slightly and they come up roots and all. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Danny Cole

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative
customer_reviews.text: Like these, but don't use them on clay soil when wet, they clump up real bad. Read some comments about nto staying on the foot. I use work boots when mowing the lawn and attached these without issue. What I did with the front laces was to use them in a "X" pattern, it seemed to help it stay on tighter. I didn't like that the straps are too long though, but understand why they are.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A D

customer_reviews.title: Cheap aerator to justify the more expensive buy
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly effective. There aren't a lot of cheaper aerators out there. Thought to give this a try. For $36 you get what you pay for. The spikes loosen over time and require retightening. .but gets the job sorta done for light aeration in the lawn. Wish the spikes went deeper or somehow removed more with each stroke. This purchase, and after the many passes on the lawn, makes me realize the value of the higher priced aerators
customer_reviews.author: TheDiaperDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Spike Shoes
customer_reviews.text: My feet would not stay in these... and the spike shoes would not come out of the ground. I found this tough to use. It was easier if I just did it by hand. Sorry... not a fan. I thought it was a good idea, but it just didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: These are exactly what they are!
customer_reviews.text: I have a small yard that I wanted to aerate without the need for a bulky tool. These shoes are easy to assemble and stay on the foot well. Metal buckles and hard thick plastic bases make it easy to assemble. For me, I had to stomp a bit to get the spikes into the turf and the "walking" motion is fairly awkward, but they do they job once you get the hang of it. If you have a large yard, this is not the solution, but for an affordable small yard solution, these fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t really work very good
customer_reviews.text: My poor husband..... bless his heart. He was so excited when they came in. But they didn’t work very well. He wanted them so bad that he couldn’t bare to trash them. So they sit in a special spot in our garage...when he’s ready I’m gonna help him part with them. But I did have a great laugh watching him wear them and walk around and then theyd flap off. And there’d he go persistent to make them work and cover ground.... and then they’d flap off again!!!! It was worth the buy watching that though!
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Burns

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, rugged device.
customer_reviews.text: These spiked shoes fit just fine over an old pair of athletic shoes. I was worried a bit about the straps, but they work just fine, clamping securely and fitting tightly to the shoes. Walking around the lawn with these things is strange, and works my legs and ankles in ways I never felt before. I'm not sure if the nail sized spikes are sufficient to aerate the lawn in a meaningful way, but time will tell. Generally, I'm pleased with a simple, easy to use and fairly rugged device.
customer_reviews.author: D. Siegel

customer_reviews.title: Aerate Your Lawn The Easy Way
customer_reviews.text: My lawn has a few hard dry spots in the sun that water can't penetrate easily. I've tried a cultivator and even a crowbar to break up the soil and it always hardens up again. Using these spikes regularly has kept the soil more friable and some filler seed has started to take. I strap on these beauties while I mow the lawn and aerate and penetrate thatch while I mow. My lawn is incredibly green right now. These worked exactly as I expected, and I'm glad I bought them. I would these recommend to anybody with a lawn.
customer_reviews.author: A.P.

customer_reviews.title: Overrated. Ankle Breaker on Less than Perfect, Debris- Free Lawns
customer_reviews.text: Undetectable debris beneath soil such as pebbles, tree nuts, roots can cause stability problems, ankle sprain, loss of balance, etc. when stepped on. Only for smooth, sod lawns (maybe). Also, need perfect soil conditions; not too dry, not too wet. Might work well on putting green.
customer_reviews.author: Sensei Rhee

customer_reviews.title: Assembly required
customer_reviews.text: Overall, not too bad but not great. The package arrived with the spikes requiring to be installed. Mine did not arrive with all of the hardware I needed. I had all the spikes, but not all of the nuts that secure the spikes to the foot plates. I am not able to walk in the shoes. They pull up dirt if you do not deliberately stop straight up and down. I tried wearing them while moving the grass one day and took them off after only two passes. I will never use these to aerate my yard like I hoped. I've limited their use to repairing some bald spot in the yard. For small areas, they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Work Exactly as Advertised!  Easy Aeration without Messing Up Lawn.
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is assembly instructions left a little to be desired. They work great and you get exercise while doing. I did entire front yard and my heart-rate was up to 155. I probably look like a dork to neighbors walking around in rows with these things on, but lawn looked great two weeks after doing so as they helped get the nutrients down to the roots. Great cheap way to aerate your lawn!
customer_reviews.author: BriBurto

customer_reviews.title: Missing half of the parts
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to using this but upon opening the box I found several parts missing. The box only included the shoes and the straps. The spikes, bolts, and wrench were all missing. I’m 33 and I’ve only encountered missing parts in purchased merchandise twice in my life. Once when I was a kid (toy) and now. I can understand broken or even defective content but missing parts are unacceptable from a consumer’s standpoint. Rarely do I give 1 star but this situation warrants it.
customer_reviews.author: Cam T.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Tap Dance on the Patio
customer_reviews.text: They were exactly what I expected and worked. I'd give them a five except one of the spikes was stripped and I could not tighten it all the way. Keep in mind these are spikes, not plugs, so you do compress the surrounding dirt a bit. It's not the perfect solution for aeration, but it beats spending hundreds of dollars buying (or $70 renting for a day) a big, gas powered aerator. So put on your headphones, and dance your way across the lawn. Good for you and your lawn. But don't tap dance on the patio.
customer_reviews.author: Kaptain Karl

customer_reviews.title: Nice Equipment
customer_reviews.text: Takes some getting used to if you are not normally high stepping using a flat foot.
customer_reviews.author: LMo

customer_reviews.title: Easy and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: If you don’t want to pay for an expensive aerator that is $57 plus, this a great inexpensive option. The straps are easy to install and tighten up.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Becerril

customer_reviews.title: Trash, waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: SUPER LOW QUALITY AND TERRIBLE QUALITY CONTROL! So, first off, they send the wrong sized bolts/screw spikes for the openings on the shoes, so when you try to tighten the nut into the screw spike the screw spike just spins around in the hole. Secondly I received some nuts with no threading inside of them... How does that even occur? Also, these look like they would snap on the first step. All in all, don’t buy them, they’re garbage.
customer_reviews.author: The Voice of Reason

customer_reviews.title: Overall this item was easy to put together but I had a hard time ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall this item was easy to put together but I had a hard time using them. Its no reflection on the product, I believe I just used them incorrectly. IT was fun walking on them but you will need to use all the straps and have them on tight. The product worked as expected and I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Viazcan

customer_reviews.title: Junk, pure junk
customer_reviews.text: These take a long time to assemble, just to constantly fall off your feet. the buckles refuse to stay tight. If the ground is even slightly wet they will stick in the ground or pull up huge divots in your yard. Stay far away.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon T.

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother, you will get tired of putting them back on
customer_reviews.text: these come with straps meant for toddlers. If you have a size 10 or bigger feet will need longer straps. They do NOT stay on. Spikes also break off and get stuck in the grass which can be dangerous for pets. This went right into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: G. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: They worked great and seem quite sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I had seen a lot of negative reviews for spike shoes such as these so I was a bit hesitant to order. I really wanted something to help me aerate my lawn so I bit the bullet and gave these a try. I was not disappointed! I had them assembled in a matter of minutes and I was very quickly stomping away on the lawn. I made sure to walk over to the lawn and put them on the lawn so that I did not push pressure on them while they were on the cement.
customer_reviews.author: Don D

customer_reviews.title: Good idea with 1 major exception...
customer_reviews.text: This product is a good idea with 1 major exception. The spikes nuts came loose after my very 1st walk with them. I nearly broke my angle when the nuts came loose. And I put them on tight. I ended up putting washers and lock washers with the supplied nuts and now they are sturdy and no problems with them now. One thing I would recommend is not trying to walk with them on dry soil. They did not Penetrate the ground very well. I watered the lawn in front and back for about 30 minutes and then they really worked. Tried again during rain (that was fun) and after a good soaking rain and that worked really well too.
customer_reviews.author: David B Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Average product, average quality, spike size differences made assembly difficult
customer_reviews.text: The spikes and nuts are not a consistent size, so assembly is not as easy as it could be. I tried to match up as many as I could, and ended up with the extra included ones not able to fit anywhere. If any of mine break or need to be replaced, I won't be able to do so. I used this on wet grass, and it was not too bad. I can't imagine trying this on dry, hard ground. They slipped off on the back several times and had to be strapped down to where it's uncomfortable to stay on when lifting your foot out of the ground. I've seen slight improvement in the turf where this was used.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product!! Took about 15 minutes to assemble. Did a great job aerating the lawn I feel. I walked through about 1000sq ft. Of newer lawn I planted a year ago. It seems the ground was having a hard time with drainage and some fungus was growing. I think the shoes helped the ground to breathe a little better. Still too early to really tell but I feel it is helped. I suggest putting the shoes on and taking them off while you are standing on the grass. I also suggest using them after it has rained when the ground is soft.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: They fall off
customer_reviews.text: They fall off, just like you are thinking it will. 1. Must assemble the product yourself, but comes with the wrench to do it; doesn’t take very long. Straps come in different lengths, so make sure they are going in the correct spot. 2. One size fits all size is too big for my size 9 feet. Straps dont fit snugly enough, so in the ground they stuck after about 10 steps.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Big mistake purchasing this.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item with high expectations. I should have known better. I will say that I have watch a few YouTube videos with other brands of the same type of shoe attachment. It didn't seem too difficult so I went ahead and bought it. Big mistake. I made about 10 steps and then it starts falling off my foot. I gave it 2 stars because the idea of it seems promising. Do not recommend. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Cuervo

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts no help from MFG
customer_reviews.text: Item came incomplete, wrote and asked for help or the missing parts. NOTHING
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: They are well made, but the application, eh...
customer_reviews.text: The product is okay, I wanted it to be great but it's not. It's well made, but for my applications, it did not work that great. TN has a lot of clay in the soil making it very compact. I fell down a lot using these and my lawn bent the spikes pretty easily on just the first use. There's really just no substitute for hiring someone to aerate your lawn and seeding it in the fall. I tried to get by on the cheap and I failed...
customer_reviews.author: Todd A. Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Back Strap Not Long Enough for size 12+
customer_reviews.text: All the straps except the back strap doesn't wrap around my shoes. Maybe someone else has a size 12+ shoe that's thinner and it works. But it's not working for me. Otherwise it's not complicated and I don't see why it wouldn't work, so the plan is to make a longer strap. Also, I'm 300lb+. The shoe is holding me up and durable. However, even with my weight, the spikes have to be worked into the ground. Kind of feel off balanced not sure which part of the spiked shoes will go in first.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty of Eden

customer_reviews.title: Why bother
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and get some scrap wood around the house drive a fe nails into it and get 550 cord and wrap it around your feet that would be much better than this product. Hate to say this but just cough up the money and go to the hardware store and rent the machine at least you'll get it done faster and with out the stress of cussing your shoes and straps
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Figaro

customer_reviews.title: Great for centipede grass
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2000 sqft centipede grass in South Florida and I only use simple lawn solutions product that make me spent double the time in my yard that my neighbors st Augustine grass. Centipede grass does not take much traffic but after I use this shoes I seen no smash in my lawn. Great addition to my lawn program.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, difficult w/ dry hard ground.
customer_reviews.text: For me I didn't have great success. I found that my ground was way too dry and hard for the shoes to penetrate. These shoes do have good quality and are well made. My only criticism is that the straps are way too short to get around your shoes. It's weird they would give such short straps. Especially around the ankle or back of shoe. I wear about a 9 in mens shoe. Can't imagine for bigger feet. Seems like an easy fix. I do have to say that I got a personal email from customer service and they seemed like that wanted to make the situation right. I do appreciate good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: A waist of money
customer_reviews.text: Not a great product. We had a small area at the lawn which we wanted to replant seeds, I thought it’s going to save us the cost of paying our Gardner but it’s just extremely not comfortable and didn’t get the results we wanted. In addition the nails got rusty after the first (and only) time of use . Didn’t work for us
customer_reviews.author: Liat Hanuka

customer_reviews.title: Did i waste my money..
customer_reviews.text: Received few days ago, on the same day i got these aerator shoes , i put them together and use them that day.. I soak my lawn and then starting walking on it.. I felt the puncture of the spikes going into the soil of my lawn going in deep into the soil.. It's to early to know if these aerator shoes work on my lawn.. One front spike kind of bent, but i have extra ((2).. In a few weeks I'll see if my lawn turn greener and hold the water on my lawn..
customer_reviews.author: robert espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Used them for the first time this weekend while cutting the grass and they worked pretty good. Only reason for not giving a 5* ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything came as described, in fact a few extra spikes and nuts. Used them for the first time this weekend while cutting the grass and they worked pretty good. Only reason for not giving a 5* is it would be nice to have a set of instructions on assembling the straps. It took 2 or 4 tries until I got them on the right way so the straps stayed on foot nice and tight. Once on right they worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Foal

customer_reviews.title: Those straps though
customer_reviews.text: Product did what I needed, nonissues or breaking. I put them on while on the grass to make sure I didn't walk on any hard surfaces, and watered for a few days before. Only issue is the instructions are not clear for the straps. I didn't pay attention, and found out after I put them on that they were different lengths. Had to tighten the straps once or twice while using.
customer_reviews.author: David H Berg

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. The straps aren’t long enough and they slip off every few seconds. I just threw them away after a few minutes of trying them
customer_reviews.author: kreyn

customer_reviews.title: Okay, not great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to aerate my lawn which isn't horribly large. They assemble moderately easy but function was my worst portion. They did aerate but it was often hard to pull from the ground and also keep attached to the shoe. I played a while but I often had to adjust and mess with the set up to make them work.
customer_reviews.author: Josh H

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: The straps are not long enough to wrap it around the shoes
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Used them for the first time today while mowing the lawn prepping for more aerating and weed and feed tomorrow. Had to mess with the straps a little, I found using two across my foot and one around the heel to be most secure. They're not bad to walk in, I do suggest a boot not a tennis shoe. My yard is in terrible shape from construction and neglect from previous owner, so time will tell ultimately.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dayton

customer_reviews.title: Open up the earth!
customer_reviews.text: My lawn is over very hard packed clay and doesn't drain well. After using these just three times I've noticed a great improvement in how the lawn holds water and fertilizer. My lawn is perking up and turning green and I can feel the improvement under my feet!
customer_reviews.author: J. Jorgenson

customer_reviews.title: These work really good if you dis the straps
customer_reviews.text: These work really good if you dis the straps!! I used some electrical tape and secured them to the bottom of an old pair of boots. I also used some short screws in the heel to help hold them on.Its so much easier to just pull on My boots then to hassle with the straps. Also,be ready to walk because if You want to cover every inch of your yard that's what you'll be doing!!!.I wear em every time I mow or use My spreader,so over time it will do some good. (Don't wear when the soil is damp,as they will clog up with mud) These are a good buy for the money
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: won't stay on
customer_reviews.text: I am really disappointed with this item. No matter how tight I make the straps, they still come off my feet.
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: Straps come loose.  Wouldn’t buy again if I had known.
customer_reviews.text: The straps kept coming loose every 5 feet or so. I was constantly having to tighten them. This made the job very time consuming. The spikes worked great though, when the shoes stayed on my feet. I think if I had wrapped some of those industrial strength plastic ties around the shoes, it would have worked better.
customer_reviews.author: Maria L.

customer_reviews.title: Functional, but must be strapped uncomfortably tight to stay on.
customer_reviews.text: These Abco Tech Lawn Aerator Shoes work as expected. They are easy to assemble, though the package contains no instructions for installing the straps correctly. The Amazon listing included a helpful diagram for this. My only complaint is that the heel piece is too short, and my shoes kept sliding over it unless I made the straps uncomfortably tight. I used these shoes while mowing my lawn, so having to stop the mower to tighten the straps every few minutes got rather annoying.
customer_reviews.author: "deevergote"

customer_reviews.title: It’s a gimmick
customer_reviews.text: These don’t work at all in clay soil. Attempted these for the first time after recent rainfall in north Texas. The soil was damp but not soggy - no standing water and not muddy. On bare spots these penetrate no problem but they also spear leaves and twigs along with clay and form basically a layer of play dough textured clay and twigs on the bottom of the sandals which prevent your next step from penetrating at all. They weren’t too difficult to walk on for flat areas, but this is basically a gimmick as they don’t actually work due to the layer of clay sticking to the bottom of the sandals mentioned above.
customer_reviews.author: Kascie

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: They come disassembled so there is some work to attach all the spikes and straps. Note, the straps are different sizes so you’ll want to lay them out first prior to putting them on (I put the short ones in the wrong spot and had to redo it). Other than that it’s great quality and works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: R. M

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and it works.
customer_reviews.text: This thing does the job and is easier than using a pitchfork. It adapts to many foot sizes. Takes minutes to put on and take off. I also use a liquid aerator and can see a marked improvement in my lawn. I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They work... kinda...
customer_reviews.text: The spikes work well. The buckles on the other hand do not secure the spikes enough to truely walk. I had to keep adjusting them. Also, the spikes are stronger than the plastic plat they secure to. This allows the spikes to wallow out the holes in the plastic plate. Its a $20 answer to aeration.... but I won’t buy them again because They are pretty much one time use.
customer_reviews.author: ADAM BOYD

customer_reviews.title: These say 'adjustable' but only for people with average size ...
customer_reviews.text: These say 'adjustable' but only for people with average size feet! My 13 year old son, who wears an adult man size 13, couldn't get them to stay on without stopping ever ten steps to reattach. I think if the straps had been a little longer it would have solved the problem, even though his toes hung out two inches beyond the end of the platform. Fits a shoes size up to about a 10-11 man. I
customer_reviews.author: OlyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Great with fertilizer!
customer_reviews.text: Wearing them while cutting the grass is probably the most effective. We then put fertilizer down and watered: 1 week later and the lawn looks GREAT! We have a mushroom problem by our sump pump drain, and so far between these shoes and fertilizer, they haven't come back. Happy homeowners!
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Buckles and Spikes
customer_reviews.text: While this product performs, there are two aspects that need some awareness. The buckles can be a little difficult to navigate and when the ground is a bit moist, the spikes can clog up making the aeration burdensome. Learning to make proper adjustments over time can help to maximize the experience.
customer_reviews.author: BadgerMan

customer_reviews.title: Gggggrrrreeeaaatttt!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with my product. One of the spikes broke already but I accidentally stepped hard on a rock. Easy to assemble and sturdy. I would recommend that the ground not be too wet because it will cause some of the earth to stick to the bottom. I waited 4 hours after I lightly watered to moisten the soil and it was perfect except for a few places in the shade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if it really helps to make lawn better/greener. Overall, it works as described. It was very straight forward to put them together. After testing first time, I needed to re-adjust straps. It is not obvious how to tighten up straps correctly, but after closely looking to the picture on the box I figured it out. The only downside I noticed is that the back side of aerator shoes pops out from time to time. It is requires to put it back and tighten it up again.
customer_reviews.author: Hrachya Petrosyan

customer_reviews.title: If you really want to aerate your lawn, i ...
customer_reviews.text: If you really want to aerate your lawn, i would suggest getting the real thing instead of these. If you're lawn is large definitely don't use these. After the first use the plastic base started to break and the spike heads. The straps would constantly slip off my shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to assemble and use
customer_reviews.text: I remember buying an item like this. I didn't have to figure out the straps or have to individually put in every spike. I does the job but for the price, couldn't it come assembled?
customer_reviews.author: Stefani S. Lake

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: These end up performing like super-hyper golf shoes, the spikes get all clogged up and don't perform their function after just a few steps.
customer_reviews.author: Oz

customer_reviews.title: Go Forth and Aerate.
customer_reviews.text: These worked great for my application. I live in the Southwest and have a well established lawn so I did not experience the "mud caking" issue as other reviewers. Also, I did not have any problems with the straps coming loose as other people reported. They are very durable and I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C.

customer_reviews.title: Problem with spikes
customer_reviews.text: The only problem was with the spikes fitting properly. The top of the spikes were smaller the the hole they fit in. So you had to hold the spikes with pliers while tightening the nut.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey boy

customer_reviews.title: I have used the spike shoes one time so far ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used the spike shoes one time so far and they seem to be fairly effective. It takes a little getting used to with a slightly different walking style. i'm going to use them again in a couple of weeks just before I overseed my lawn. Hope that it helps.
customer_reviews.author: A. Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and as long as the yard is somewhat moist they work great to aerate those hard to get to spots. They attach to your shoes or boots very easily and stay in place without loosening up.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Brauer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure the ground is not too wet
customer_reviews.text: My original order came with one defective spike, but the vendor mailed a replacement spike. I made the mistake of using the aerator spike shoes after it rained a little bit. The shoes got muddy quickly, and considerably less effective. So although they recommend using it on wet ground, make sure it's not too wet, or the mud will make the spikes difficult to use.
customer_reviews.author: LYNash

customer_reviews.title: straps are hard to adjust.
customer_reviews.text: Its hard to keep it attached to the shoes with the straps. It keeps coming off. The nails on the bottom started collecting dirt around the spaces which doesn't make any holes.
customer_reviews.author: Niewtidus AJ

customer_reviews.title: Need to be heavy and strong!
customer_reviews.text: These are good for a big person. I bought them for my mother and it’s almost impossible for her to use them. She needs to wear her large work boots and had a hard time to press the spikes all the way into the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Husband used once only. Difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: Omgosh husband couldn’t walk with them on. Lost balance, legs became fatigued quickly and muscles hurt almost immediately but they did remain on while he attempted to use them. He’s only used them one time.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: simple and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: simple and easy to use...set up is also ok and not difficult. the straps do hold well to shoe...Only reco is to make the green platform host a bit thicker and heavier....it is a good workout tool It remains to be seen if the grass benefits from the spikes given my daily walking over the lawn ...maybe in a month i will know!
customer_reviews.author: ray

customer_reviews.title: ) they were pretty simple to put together and the straps were easy ...
customer_reviews.text: These are handy little shoes:) they were pretty simple to put together and the straps were easy to figure out also. They did the job that I needed, I got my lawn aerated and threw down some weed and feed and the grass has started to in just a few weeks! Thank u for this product:)
customer_reviews.author: autumn lehman

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to use, kept loosening up while using. Also didn’t realize the straps were different lengths which fits best on certain ends of the platform. Be sure it’s on secure, you don’t want it to loosen up to much and feel the other end. But once you have the straps, in right order and with lock lever right comfortable position to adjust, works great. I do run a lot but even after using this, I felt and nice little work out feel on my calves when I was done. For price, its great.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Escobar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use once you get them assembled. Just walk around your backyard or wear them while you mow the grass either way you'll improve the quality of your yard.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Lord

customer_reviews.title: Needs MAJOR ergonomic refinement!
customer_reviews.text: First , you've got to supply some thorough assembly instructions, especially on how & where each strap is located and installed.I appreciate your efforts to providing 'aeration possibility' for residential lawn areas BUT, you really need major ergonomic refinement in their design and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I've only had a chance to use this once, and it turns out the sod in my lawn is dead, so the spikes just pulled up the sod squares. However, for the parts of my lawn that are alive and have taken root, this seems to be a great product - an excellent alternative to overpriced hand aerators that have way fewer spikes (hence take longer to aerate the whole lawn). I got my order quickly, it's excellent quality, and I would definitely buy from this seller again!
customer_reviews.author: Julia A. Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: The are JUNK
customer_reviews.text: just junk,,,totally will not stay on and hard to walk with in the grass I can not get credit unless I return the item and I have no way of doing that which i why I order online in the first place
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Good way to Aerate
customer_reviews.text: These worked great...would work better for men with large feet but my 9 1/2 inch woman shoe worked too...definitely don't want to be using them if the ground is fairly wet or bone dry but anything in-between is good.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Straps do not stay tight - shoes fall off consistently
customer_reviews.text: Due to lack of structural integrity within the boot straps, the shoes consistently fall off making the effectiveness minimal at best. If this product used a plastic binding like on cheap hockey skates or snow board it would really make a better product. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: try something else
customer_reviews.text: straps are terrible, the dirt gets stuck to them and doesn't have good install instructions since all the straps seem to be different sizes
customer_reviews.author: dmercer

customer_reviews.title: Aeration of lawn grass
customer_reviews.text: The pro is that it's easy to use, the con is it's hard to pull up after stepping down, takes a lot of effort to lift up what more if u keep walking to aerate the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Friendship Plumbing

customer_reviews.title: Price was right, as was service, the product ...
customer_reviews.text: Price was right, as was service, the product was packaged by the manufacturer 1 nut short, thus I had to not use 1 spike until I go to a store and buy a nut (or go thru my garage supply) . Product use will not eliminate the need for lawn aerator treatments
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time and money!
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep this review simple and sweet: Don't waste your money and time! These are horrible. I think it's better to get a real aerator.
customer_reviews.author: K. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan. Didn’t work very well, was awkward and we ended up paying someone to come and do it for us.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Fields

customer_reviews.title: Great product - Sturdier than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I have been looking for and it is very sturdy. We have a very large lot and there is lots of clay in some areas and the water doesn't penetrate well. I wanted something that I could use myself but my husband liked it so well I may never get the opportunity.
customer_reviews.author: IDGRL

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I like this product but it has a couple of flaw designs. However you can’t beat the price. The Spikes routinely come loose. After several yards of Aerating your lawn I recommend you stop & check the Spikes. Retighten them as needed or you could break the the plastic anchor points. The Straps also routinely come loose. Check & readjust often to avoid a tripping hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Axel Caro

customer_reviews.title: One spike came flat not spikey.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my husband these lawn spikes because he's always doing lawn work. However, one of the spikes came flat and my husband was not happy about it. Therefore, we are giving this item 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jarmeise

customer_reviews.title: They slide when on
customer_reviews.text: They work ok but even on the tightest, your shoe slides to one side making it harder to walk and ensure the spikes go fully into the soil.
customer_reviews.author: Calvert

customer_reviews.title: Keeps coming off
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend this product. It keeps coming off , the harness belts buckles are not strong . Don't buy this product
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Just terrible
customer_reviews.text: Arrives and some of the spikes don't fit in....doesn't fit well to feet, and just shouldn't have bothered.....
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: It doenst work as it will not stay strapped to your foot...
customer_reviews.author: christian

customer_reviews.title: dont buy
customer_reviews.text: The straps are way to long and dont stay tight. They constantly fell off, returned immediately. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Kaytee

customer_reviews.title: They do the job
customer_reviews.text: These are ok and they do the job BUT the straps are useless. I ended up getting some zip ties and that did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: wh6276

product_meta.title: Abco Tech Lawn Aerator Shoes - for Effectively Aerating Lawn Soil - 3 Adjustable Straps and Heavy Duty Metal Buckles - One Size Fits All - Easy Use for a Healthier Yard and Garden
feature_bullets: PROFESSIONAL GRADE AERATION – Wear our Abcosport Lawn Aerator Spike Shoes and walk around to cover the entire length of your garden for a way greener, healthier and more beautiful lawn and grass. Even better- wear them while mowing your lawn so that you accomplish two important tasks simultaneously!

INEXPENSIVE AND FUN ALTERNATIVE – The lawn aerator shoes offer a superior alternative over the professional gardening services which might cost you fortunes on lawn care and maintenance. However, these shoes are a one time investment that’s going to help you with several hundred cycles of yard aeration, and if maintained well even for a lifetime.

SUPERIOR BUILD – Our aerators are made up of a sturdy plastic base with good heel support, 13 heavy duty metal 48 mm spikes on each sandal, and 3 adjustable straps with strong buckles, designed to be highly anti-corrosive and durable. The shoes stay firmly on your feet and the sharp nails make it easy to dig the soil, and an effective core aerator.

EASY TO INSTALL AND USE – Abcosport aerator shoe yard tools also come with a FREE small wrench to make the installation extremely easy. Once installed the lawn aeration shoes can be strapped over any of your strong shoes, making you ready even for the most difficult to reach areas of your lawn.

SATISFACTION GUARANTEED – Abco lawn aeration shoes come with a 100% risk-free satisfaction guarantee to let you buy with confidence; no questions asked. However, we are quite sure that you will find these spike aerator shoes sturdy and functionally effective as you watch your lawn get greener.
